name: The Courtyard Baithak- An Evening of Hindustani Classical Music
description: This will be Courtyard Baithak's first classical recital. The Baithak will feature Khayal, Thumri, and Abhang by Siddhartha Belmannu.The Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the Artist - Siddhartha BelmannuSiddhartha Belmannu is acclaimed as a musical prodigy and a trailblazer in Indian classical music. Hailing from Karkala, a quaint town in the Udupi district of Karnataka, Siddhartha’s remarkable vocal talent was evident from an early age. His musical journey began with Carnatic Classical Music, but it was under the esteemed guidance of Sri P.R. Manjunath that he delved into Hindustani Classical Music. His path took a transformative turn with the mentorship of Pandit Vinayak Torvi, a revered maestro of the Gwalior and Kirana gharanas. This extensive training, spanning 13 years in the Gurukul system, allowed Siddhartha to refine his skills and create a distinct style that harmoniously blends tradition with contemporary innovation. His exceptional achievements earned him a special mention in Forbes’ '30 under 30' list for 2021 in the music category.Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: enVie launch
description: A Connoisseur's ConvergenceYou are cordially invited to an exclusive soirée marking the debut of enVie.Join us for a sensory journey as we unveil a world of unparalleled luxury, meticulously crafted. Indulge in exquisite cocktails & curated culinary creations from our master chef, accompanied by the enchanting melodies of live music. Surround yourself with an invite only elite clientele as we celebrate the birth of enVie.31 August, 8 pm onwardsAttire: Get fancy, or comfortable, or both. Bring your dancing shoes ;)Please note that this is an invitation-only event.Love enVie

name: Chocolate Profiling Workshop with Manam Chocolate: Unlocking the Endless Possibilities of Cacao
description: About the Workshop at The ConservatoryThis session starts with a brief on the history of Cacao, starting from its Mesoamerican origin and culminating in the present-day transformation into the world of craft chocolate. It traverses through 3 centuries and multiple geo-political events and how they affected the story of Cacao and chocolate and tries to speak about what the future might hold for chocolate and how we at Manam Chocolate see ourselves fit into that narrative. This discussion will be followed by a profiling session that forms an introduction to appreciating craft chocolate. It includes an introduction to aroma training, and taste training and takes the audience through tasting various samples of craft chocolate and defects (Industrial Chocolate). Workshop by CHAITANYA MUPPALA,FOUNDER & CEO, MANAM CHOCOLATE & DISTINCT ORIGINS PRIVATE LIMITED Chaitanya Muppala is the CEO of Distinct Origins Private Limited, which launched Manam Chocolate, an Indian Craft Chocolate brand. A second-generation entrepreneur with over 10 years of experience in the Indian food industry, Chaitanya holds a degree from Sauder School of Business, UBC, and has completed the Stanford Seed Program. In 2021, he founded Distinct Origins to develop India’s fine-flavor cacao industry, establishing the country’s largest cacao fermentary in West Godavari. He also built Manam Chocolate, which launched in August 2023. Before this, Chaitanya led Almond House, a renowned premium sweets brand, expanding its reach across South India.Workshop AgendaIntroduction to Cacao's Origin and History ● Mesoamerican origins of cacao ● Role of cacao in ancient civilizations (Mayans, Aztecs) ● Cacao as a sacred beverage and currency Cacao in the Age of Exploration ● Arrival of cacao in Europe ● Transformation of cacao into a chocolate drink ● Spread of chocolate culture in Europe Industrial Revolution and Mass Production ● Development of chocolate manufacturing processes ● Mass production and availability of chocolate ● Emergence of famous chocolate brands Geo-Political Events and Chocolate ● Impact of World Wars on chocolate production and consumption ● Post-war chocolate boom Craft Chocolate Renaissance ● Rise of craft chocolate makers ● Focus on quality, ethics, and sustainability ● Artisanal production methods and single-origin chocolates Future ● Changing consumer preferences (health-conscious, ethical sourcing) ● Sustainability challenges in cacao farming ● Innovation in chocolate production (flavors, techniques) Manam Chocolates Role in the Narrative ● Our commitment to quality craft chocolate ● Contribution to preserving cacao's heritage and elevating the chocolate experienceIntroduction to Craft Chocolate Appreciation ● Aroma Training:● Importance of aroma in chocolate tasting Trends in Chocolate ● Identifying different aroma profiles (fruity, nutty, floral) ● Taste Training: ● Understanding taste elements (sweetness, acidity, bitterness) ● Recognizing flavour complexities in craft chocolate Chocolate Tasting Session ● Sampling various craft chocolate bars: - Single-origin chocolate - Different flavor profiles (dark, milk, white) - Note-taking and sharing tasting experiences Defect Identification ● Introduction to common defects found in industrial chocolate Conclusion and Q&A Recap of key points in the journey of cacao and chocolate Open floor for questions and discussions about craft chocolate, its appreciation, and the future of the industry. Terms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen."Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: The Kids Playdate - Ganesha Habba!
description: Our monthly playdate is back!The beloved Ganesha play date is here!The LooRoo Club and Courtyard are excited to invite you to a celebration of one of our favourite festivals - Ganesha Habba! The day will be filled with making clay Ganeshas, playing with flowers, listening to stories about him, making sweet treats, and getting your hands messy and creative with some exciting art and fun activities at the play date! True to LooRoo style, we’ll have a whole lot of nature-inspired sensory play that’s as messy as it is magical! Think squishy, slimy, and utterly delightful fun—all in the spirit of Ganesha!For Kids aged 3+ and their parentsTerms and ConditionsThe management bears no responsibility for any injury or damage incurred during the event.Purchase tickets exclusively from the designated ticketing platform.No refunds for no-shows or cancellations under any circumstances.Tickets are non-transferable and intended for personal use only.Event schedule and menu subject to change in case of emergencies or events beyond our control.The management will not entertain liability claims arising from the consumption of food or beverages.Parking near the event venue is at the vehicle owner's risk. Paid valet parking available at Rs. 200 per car.Ticket holders grant organizers perpetual rights to use any recorded video or still footage of their appearance on any channel, without further approval.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Hosa, Goa at The Conservatory | Chef Harish Rao’s Experiments with South Indian Tapas
description: About the MealCurated by Harish Rao, Executive Chef, Hosa, the menu offers a blend of traditional and modern dishes. Guests can savor unique creations like Pondicherry Bouillabaisse, Chicken Paniyaram, Kari Dosa and Mutton Pepper Roast—each crafted to showcase the rich culinary heritage of South India.About Chef Harish RaoChef Harish Rao is a celebrated culinary expert with over 20 years of experience, renowned for his innovative approach to South Indian cuisine. He has successfully led prestigious restaurants like Dakshin in Chennai and played a key role in launching Avartana at ITC Grand Chola. As the Executive Chef at HOSA, Goa, he continues to introduce exciting new dishes that highlight the intricate and diverse flavors of traditional South Indian regional cuisines.About HosaHOSA, meaning ‘new’ in Kannada, redefines South Indian flavors with an innovative twist and a vibrant bar scene. HOSA’s menu features standout dishes like Guntur Crab Fry, ghee roasts, Vada Kari and Curry Leaf-Cured Snapper, all paired with tropical cocktails and an extensive wine list. Recognized as Goa’s ‘Best Modern Indian Restaurant’ and ‘Best Restobar’ by the Times Food & Nightlife Awards in 2023, HOSA also earned accolades in 2024 for ‘Best Modern South Indian’ and ‘Best Cocktails.’ They received four ultimate stars from Culinary Culture Co. 2024HOSA (A la carte menu)Small PlatesVegetarianTengaipal Rasam (400)Spiced young coconut broth, smoked coconut meat, tomato salsa, coriander oilAlmond 65 (600)Crispy almond fritters, yogurt rice, pomeloVazhakai Pepper Roast (600)Raw plantain tossed in onion tomato pepper masalaShimiji Mushroom Varuval (700)Mushroom mousse, pickled green peppersNon-VegetarianKozhi Rasam (600)Spiced chicken broth, chicken varuvaMutton Pepper Roast (810)Coconut shavings, garlic chipsH F C (Hosa Fried Chicken) (700)Cucumber yogurt dipToddy Shop Prawns (850)Raw mango saladKari Dosa (700)Spiced mutton dosa, curried hollandaise, poached eggs. A take on classic Madurai kari dosaLarge PlatesVegetarianTrumpet Mushroom Varuval (840)Wild mushroom pongal, pepper jusAubergine Steak (840)Burnt aubergine mash, sesame peanut curry, yogurt sphereSweet and Sour Pineapple (700)Chargrilled sweet and sour pineapple curryNon-VegetarianKappa Meen Curry (1200)Tapioca mash, grilled seabass, Malabar tamarind sauceG.O.A.T (1200)Tender lamb shank simmered in spicy gravyChicken Serva / Kalaki (830)Our take on the local street foods of Tamil NaduStaples (195 each)Coin PorottaIdiappam – String HoppersSteamed RiceGhee Rice (250)Desserts (550)Ragi Molten Lava CakeOrange ice cream, almond crumbleFilter Coffee TiramisuCoffee, ruskTerms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

A take on classic Madurai kari dosaLarge PlatesVegetarianTrumpet Mushroom Varuval (840)Wild mushroom pongal, pepper jusAubergine Steak (840)Burnt aubergine mash, sesame peanut curry, yogurt sphereSweet and Sour Pineapple (700)Chargrilled sweet and sour pineapple curryNon-VegetarianKappa Meen Curry (1200)Tapioca mash, grilled seabass, Malabar tamarind sauceG.O.A.T (1200)Tender lamb shank simmered in spicy gravyChicken Serva / Kalaki (830)Our take on the local street foods of Tamil NaduStaples (195 each)Coin PorottaIdiappam – String HoppersSteamed RiceGhee Rice (250)Desserts (550)Ragi Molten Lava CakeOrange ice cream, almond crumbleFilter Coffee TiramisuCoffee, ruskTerms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: Onam Sadhya - A taste of Kerala
description: Chef Mako, a half Malayali, and Akash Murali, a Kerala-born chef , are coming together to curate a unique Onam Sadhya experience at Love Ooru, Koramangala. This collaboration promises a festive feast that showcasing a rich array of traditional dishes prepared with fresh, local ingredients. Join them for an unforgettable culinary journey that honors the spirit of Kerala’s most cherished festival.This curated community-style vegetarian lunch will include a 29-dish spread including Kadachakka Kuzhachatu (Breadfruit Stir Fry), Parippu Curry, Mathanga Elisseri (Yellow Pumpkin & peas curry ), Pavaka Theeyal (Spicy Bitter-gourd & tamarind gravy) Pineapple Kichadi, Avial, Red Rice & 2 payasams - Ada Pradhaman & Paal Payasam served on a banana leaf.*Takeaway option available between 12-4pm for minimum 2 person.What's an Onam Sadhya?Sadhya is not just about the food but also about community and togetherness. Families and friends come together to prepare and enjoy the meal, reflecting the spirit of unity and prosperity that the festival embodies. Onam Sadhya is a traditional vegetarian feast from Kerala, India, served during the festival of Onam, which celebrates the harvest season and the return of the mythical King Mahabali. The word "Sadhya" means banquet or feast in Malayalam, and this meal is a significant aspect of Onam celebrations.Venue: Love OORU﻿Rooftop / Sunsets / Wine & Grills https://www.instagram.com/love.ooru/?hl=enChef Mako : https://www.instagram.com/chef_mako?igsh=dndubmd6N21wOXBxAkash Murali : https://www.instagram.com/akashfooddoc?igsh=MWtrOXZ6c3JsZWRpbg==

location.name: love OORU
location.address: No. 136, Evergreen PARC, Rooftop, 1st Cross Road, 5th Block,, Koramangala, KHB Colony, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: love OORU
organizer.description: love.OORU is a tranquil oasis on the rooftop which is the perfect setting for enjoying beautiful sunsets, hosting private dinners & events, and maybe indulging in a chef's table experience.  Taking inspiration from Bengaluru, her history, geography, culture, and most importantly her stories, love.OORU was born as an identity rooted in Bengaluru and all it has to offer.

name: Sip & Read
description: Come, join us for a Sunday where time slows, and the only sound is the gentle hum of turning pages. Sip & Read is back, this time at the cozy HeyBrewty studio, where earthy tones and a soft sun glow welcome us all. 🤗We’ll spend an hour immersed in our books, sipping on tea brews, followed by light-hearted chats that stir up fond reading memories—all with gentle acoustics playing in the background.Bring whatever you love to read—be it a paperback, Kindle, magazine, or newspaper—or explore something new from our library! Consider it a mini getaway from your usual weekend errands, with phones also taking a much-needed rest.Plus, there’ll be fun giveaways for you to take home! ✨📚 Get cozy with a good book alongside fellow readers💬 Jump into lively convos🍷 Enjoy a complimentary tea with a light bite📍 At HeyBrewty Wellness Studio, Ashok NagarBonus: Free Bookmark Premium membership and mementos for keepsakes!

location.address: Hotel Ajantha, 22/A, Craig Park Layout, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Bookmark App
organizer.description: Bookmark is a dating app for readers. It connects people based on not just what books they like, but also other attributes and interests about their personality, distance, the relationship they are seeking, gender preferences, and more. Download and try it today!

name: Pop Pilates with Manasa + Nourishing Brunch
description: This is a chance to discover a fun new format- Pop Pilates, a dynamic fusion of Pilates-inspired movements set to energising music, designed to strengthen your body from head to toe, led by the amazing Manasa.Join us for this fun yet challenging session followed by a delicious, nourishing brunch by the Copper + Cloves Chef TeamEvent FlowWe'll start with the Pop Pilates class, and following this we'll all sit together and eat a sharing-style nourishing brunch. This is a great way to meet new people if you are new to the city. This is a beginner-friendly class.

location.name: Copper + Cloves
location.address: 4th Floor, 167, 2nd Stage, 2nd Cross, Shankarnag Rd, Stage 2, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

organizer.name: Copper + Cloves
organizer.description: We are all about nourishing food and creating spaces for connection!

name: Slow Flow Yoga + Flower Binding Therapy + High Tea
description: Slow Flow Yoga + Flower Binding Therapy + High TeaJoin us for an serene afternoon of tranquility and creativity. This unique experience combines a slow yoga flow followed by a flower binding workshop, and a delicious high tea.Event FlowSlow Flow & Flower MeditationWe'll begin with a gentle Slow Flow yoga session, transitioning into a guided flower meditation practice. Each participant will receive a fresh garden rose for the meditation, where you'll explore techniques such as Visualization, Gazing, and Breathwork. These practices will help you cultivate inner peace, gratitude, and a deep connection to the natural world.Flower Binding TherapyFollowing the meditation you will create your own rose bouquet in this therapeutic session, guided by Nidhi from Shades of Spring.Known for its ability to reduce anxiety, enhance creativity, and promote emotional release, flower binding therapy harnesses the high vibrational energy of roses to foster relaxation and mental well-being.High TeaConclude the event with a delightful High Tea experience. Continuing our theme, enjoy a refreshing rose-infused drink and a delicate rose energy ball, as well as canapes, sandwiches and cakes. Everyone will eat and chat together, so it's a lovely chance to meet new people and try new things.

location.name: Copper + Cloves

name: Gravy and Pie Shop with Chef Aarohi Sanghavi from MÄKI Patisserie
description: Gravy and Pie Shop at The ConservatoryOur glasshouse transforms into a Gravy & Pie shop for the weekend, serving up brasserie-style food, all doused in rich gravies and sauces.Chef Aarohi Sanghavi from Mäki has drawn inspiration from pies served around the world, applying Mäki’s unique adaptations. Hearty, warm, and comforting—these are the emotions we're aiming to evoke.Expect flaky, buttery, crumbly crusts encasing a flavorful interior, served with sauces that complement every bite.Pie shop MenuSavoury PiesPigs in a blanket with Grape Mostarda - ₹680B**f Bourgignon Shepherds Pie - But not like you’re used to - ₹680Chicken and Black Garlic Pithivier - ₹620GaletteFresh goats cheese, roasted beets and nigella - ₹500Sausage, pecorino and baked quail egg - ₹530Zucchini and Caper Filo Pie with Pistachio Pesto - ₹530Smoked Aubergine, mushroom, and tomato Bake with Cheddar and Sesame crust - ₹560Sweet PiesCold Chocolate Banana Cream Pie - ₹480Warm Apple Crumble Tart with crème anglaise - ₹470Hojicha Tart Tropezienne with Plum sauce - ₹428Goats Cheese and Pink Guava Pastelitos - ₹470Terms and Conditions: The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an event.Conservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.Each slot, lasting 2 hours only, requires attendance at the booked time, with no accommodation for attendance at any other slot except the one booked.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Children over 7 years of age require a ticket.Children below the age of 7 are not allowed.No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval of theirs.

name: 'Monsters, Inc.' (2001) Movie Screening | Family Movie Night
description: Family Movie Night at The Studio, Courtyard, ShantinagarJoin us as we watch a series of carefully curated rare masterpieces from around the world, made just for kids. Watch this film while cozying up with your family!Given the nature of the film, we recommend it for children aged 7 and older.About the movie:"Monsters, Inc." is a 2001 animated film by Pixar Animation Studios. Set in the city of Monstropolis, the film explores a world where monsters generate power for their city by scaring children. The story follows two main characters: Sulley, a large, gentle blue monster with purple spots, and his best friend Mike Wazowski, a small, green, one-eyed monster.Why Attend?Broaden Horizons with Global Tales: Dive into diverse artistic expressions through rare masterpieces curated for children.Quality Family Bonding: Embark on a cinematic journey to a new country each month, forging lasting memories and strengthening family connections.Uncover Hidden Treasures: Discover lesser-known gems handpicked for their artistic brilliance and captivating storytelling.Artistic Excellence: Immerse your child in films of unparalleled artistic merit, fueling their imagination and creativity.Safe Family Environment: Enjoy movies in a secure, family-friendly setting, ensuring a worry-free experience for kids and parents alike.Don't miss this opportunity to create lasting memories with your family while exposing your kids to the wonders of world cinema.Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.The Event is taking place at Courtyard's indoor Studio space on the second floor.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Children above the age of 3 need a ticket to attend the event.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain or other unforeseen conditions, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Sunday Breakfast with Strangers
description: Looking to meet new people and make friends in Bangalore? Join a Sunday breakfast table, where you can enjoy a delicious meal and connect with strangers in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere. This event is perfect for those who want to expand their social circle, share interesting conversations, and start their Sunday on a positive note. Whether you're new to the city or just looking to meet like-minded people, this gathering offers a welcoming space to create meaningful connections. Bring your appetite for both food and friendship!

location.address: 163, 15th Main Rd, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: TwoTablesClub
organizer.description: Where a small group of strangers come together for genuine conversations & spontaneous connections  over a curated meal. Guided by a host every Table is a mix of locals & newcomers sharing stories of their roots & dreams
